The target sandbox for the eToken, when empty, the token won't have any access to a particular sandbox
member.returns: Developer eToken for specific serviceConfigurationId and sandbox

The target sandbox list for the eToken, when empty, the token won't have any access to a particular sandbox
member.returns: Developer eToken for specific serviceConfigurationId and sandbox

member.summary: Attempt to fetch a test xToken without triggering any UI.

member.summary: Provides methods for configuring Xbox Live.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.DevTools.XblConfig.ConfigurationManager.GetSandboxDocumentsAsync(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously gets sandbox level documents for a given SCID.
member.param: The service configuration ID.
The sandbox.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.DevTools.XblConfig.ConfigurationManager.CommitSandboxDocumentsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.IO.FileStream},System.Guid,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously commits sandbox level documents back to Xbox Live.
member.param: A collection of objects pointing to files to commit.
The service configuration ID to commit to.
The sandbox to commit to.
The ETag of the previous commit used for concurrency checks. If null, the ETag from the latest commit will be used.
Set to 'true' if a test commit should be performed without persisting the data resulting in validation only; 'false' persists the commit.
The commit message asssociated with this changeset.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.DevTools.XblConfig.ConfigurationManager.CommitSandboxDocumentsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Guid,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously commits sandbox level documents back to Xbox Live.
member.param: A collection of file paths to commit.
The service configuration ID to commit to.
The sandbox to commit to.
The ETag of the previous commit used for concurrency checks. If null, the ETag from the latest commit will be used.
Set to 'true' if a test commit should be performed without persisting the data resulting in validation only; 'false' persists the commit.
The commit message asssociated with this changeset.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.DevTools.XblConfig.ConfigurationManager.GetAccountDocumentsAsync(System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously gets a specific account level document.
member.param: The account ID of the user to obtain documents for.
The filename of the file to retrieve.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.DevTools.XblConfig.ConfigurationManager.GetAccountDocumentsAsync(System.Guid)
member.summary: Asynchronously gets account level documents.
member.param: The account ID of the user to obtain documents for.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.DevTools.XblConfig.ConfigurationManager.CommitAccountDocumentsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.IO.FileStream},System.Guid,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Commits account level documents back to Xbox Live.
member.param: A collection of objects containing the files to commit.
The account ID of the user account which owns these files.
The ETag of the previous commit used for concurrency checks. If null, the ETag from the latest commit will be used.
Set to 'true' if a test commit should be performed without persisting the data resulting in validation only; 'false' persists the commit.
The commit message asssociated with this changeset.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Xbox.Services.DevTools.XblConfig.ConfigurationManager.CommitAccountDocumentsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Guid,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Commits account level documents back to Xbox Live.
member.param: A collection of file paths to commit.
The account ID of the user account which owns these files.
The ETag of the previous commit used for concurrency checks. If null, the ETag from the latest commit will be used.
Set to 'true' if a test commit should be performed without persisting the data resulting in validation only; 'false' persists the commit.
The commit message asssociated with this changeset.
